div.l: That dwelten in the halle / of which I seye
Testyf they were / and lusty for to pleye
And oonly for hir myrthe / and her revelrye
Vpon ther wardeyn / ful besily they crye
To yeve hem leve / but a litel stoıı̄unde
To go to the mille / ⁊and seen her corn I groıı̄unde
And hardily they durste / leyn her necke
The miller shuld / nat stele hem half a pecke
Of corn ne be sleyhte / ne be force hem bereve
And at the laste / the wardeyn yaf hem leve
Iohn hihte that oon / Aleyn hihte that other
Of o toıı̄un were they born / that hihte strothir
Fer in the north / I can nat tellen where
This Aleyn maketh redy / al his gere
And on an hors he caste the sek a noon
Forth goth Aleyn the clerk / and also Iohn
With swerd ⁊and bokeler / bi his side
Iohn knew the way wel / hym nedid no guyde
And at the mille the sak doıı̄un he laith
Aleyn spak first / al heill Symond in faith
How faris thi faire douhter ⁊and thi wyf
Welcom̄ Aleyn qduod Symkyn bi my lyf
And Iohn Also /oouh what do ye now heere
Bi god qduod Iohn / neede hath no peere
Hym bi hovis serve hym self / that hath no swayn
Or ellis he is a fool / as clerkis seyn
Our manciple I hope / he wol be ded
Swa warkes ay / the wanges in his hed
And therfore I am come / and eek Aleyn
To grynde our corn / and carye it ham a geyn
I pray you speed vs hens / yf that ye may
It shal be do / qduod symkyn bi my fay
What wol ye don / whil it is on honde
Bi god riht bi the hoper / wol I stonde
Quod Aleyn and se how the corn gas In
Yit saw I neuyr bi my fadir kyn
How that the hopir / waggis twa an fra Collation holder
